curam.util.persistence.helper
Class SingleTableLogicallyDeleteableEntityImpl<S extends DeepCloneable>

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.persistence.helper.EntityImpl
      curam.util.persistence.helper.SingleTableEntityImpl<S>
          curam.util.persistence.helper.SingleTableLogicallyDeleteableEntityImpl<S>
Type Parameters:
S - the generated Curam "dtls" struct which holds a row of data from the physical database table.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Entity<java.lang.Long>, EntityInfoSetter<java.lang.Long,SingleTableEntityImpl<S>,S>, Lifecycle<curam.codetable.impl.RECORDSTATUSEntry>, LogicallyDeleteable, Insertable, Modifiable, OptimisticLockable, OptimisticLockModifiable, OptimisticLockRemovable, Removable, StandardEntity, Validator
public abstract class SingleTableLogicallyDeleteableEntityImpl<S extends DeepCloneable>
extends SingleTableEntityImpl<S>
implements LogicallyDeleteable

Standard implementation for a commonly-used Curam application pattern. Implements an entity which:

  • stores its data on a single physical database table;
  • contains standard insert and modify operations;
  • supports optimistic locking; and
  • supports logical deletes.
The database table must contain a text column named recordStatus, storing a value from the RECORDSTATUS code table.

cancel

public void cancel()
            throws InformationalException
Logically deletes the database row. Raises a validation error if the row has been logically deleted, or if the entity contains fields with unsaved changes.

Throws:
InformationalException - if the row has been logically deleted, or if the entity contains fields with unsaved changes.
